title.title: Scrappage scheme for vans and minibuses

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["The Mayor of London has launched a scrappage scheme to help improve London's toxic air. It supports businesses with up to 50 employees to replace vehicles that don't meet the Ultra Low Emission Zone (ULEZ) standards."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}

If your vehicle doesn't meet the stricter ULEZ emissions standards you will need to pay a daily charge to drive within the zone. Under the scrappage scheme, eligible businesses with up to 50 employees and charities can apply for funds to scrap up tothree older, more polluting vans and charity minibuses and switch to cleaner vehicles.
Find out if your vehicle meets the ULEZ standards for vans and minibuses .
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Cars, motorcycles and mopeds"}

The Mayor of London has launched the ULEZ car and motorcycle scrappage scheme to help low income and disabled Londoners scrap these older, more polluting vehicles in favour of cleaner ones and promote greener forms of transport to help clean the city's toxic air.

{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Grant payment options"}
If you meet the eligibility criteria for vehicles and organisations you can apply for one of three funds:
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Option 1: Scrappage for frequent users of the Congestion Charge area (£7,000)"}
The vehicle being scrapped must:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Have been driven within the Congestion Charge zone at least 26 times between 22 August 2018 and 22 February 2019 (six months before the start of the scrappage scheme). This will be checked against existing transactions in your London Road User Charging account.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eFor journeys made outside of Congestion Charge operational hours (07:00-18:00, Monday to Friday) we will consider evidence of travel","Be a pre-Euro 6 diesel light van (or charity-owned minibus) that doesn't meet the ULEZ standards"]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Option 2: Scrappage and purchase/lease of Euro 6 replacement (£7,000)"}
The vehicle being scrapped must be:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["A pre-Euro 6 diesel light van (or charity-owned minibus) that doesn't meet the ULEZ standards","Replaced by purchase, lease or hire (for at least two years) with a Euro 6 diesel light van or Euro 6 diesel minibus (for charities only)"]}
The eligible business must be registered at a Greater London address.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Option 3: Scrappage and contribution towards running costs (including insurance) of an electric vehicle (£9,500)"}
The grant payment is made up of £7,000 for scrapping ULEZ non- compliant vehicles plus a £2,500 contribution towards running costs (including insurance) of a replacement electric vehicle(s).
The vehicle being scrapped must be:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["A pre-Euro 6 diesel light van (or charity-owned minibus) that does not meet the ULEZ standards","Replaced by purchase, lease or hire (for at least two years ) with an electric light van or electric minibus (for charities only)"]}
For an eligible businessnot registered in Greater London the vehicle must also:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Have been driven within the Congestion Charge zone at least 26 times between 22 August 2018 and 22 February 2019 (six months before the start of the scrappage scheme). This will be checked against existing transactions in your London Road User Charging account.\u003cbr /\u003e\u003cbr /\u003eFor journeys made outside of Congestion Charge operational hours we will consider evidence of travel."]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Refund of ULEZ charges"}
Successful applicants will be refunded any ULEZ charges paid for the scrapped vehicle(s) during the three months after their application was submitted providing they were paid via Auto Pay.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Organisation and vehicle eligibility"}
For Option 2 and Option 3, organisations must be able to prove that they're registered at an address in a London borough or the City of London .
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Micro businesses must have:"}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["10 or fewer employees","Up to £632k turnover\u003cstrong\u003eOR \u003c/strong\u003e up to £316k balance sheet total in the preceding and current financial year AND","Companies House registration as an active company in the UK\u003cstrong\u003eOR\u003c/strong\u003e be VAT registered in the UK"]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Small businesses must have:"}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["50 or fewer employees","An annual turnover of not more than £10.2 million\u003cstrong\u003eOR\u003c/strong\u003e a balance sheet total of not more than £5.1 million AND","Companies House registration as an active company in the UK\u003cstrong\u003eOR\u003c/strong\u003e be VAT registered in the UK"]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Sole traders must be:"}
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["A self-employed person who owns and operates a business as an individual"]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Charities must be an:"}
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Entity registered with the Charity Commission as an active charity"]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Vehicle(s) you intend to scrap must be:"}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["A van owned by an eligible business with up to and including 50 employees, or a minibus owned by a registered charity, for more than calendar 12 months before the start of the scrappage scheme on 22 February 2019","Insured for business use","Road taxed with a valid MOT","Scrapped at an approved \u003ca href=\"https://environment.data.gov.uk/public-register/view/search-elv\"\u003eAuthorised Treatment Facility (ATF)\u003c/a\u003e "]}
The vehicle that you want to scrap must also fail to meet the

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Read the Scrappage scheme terms and conditions and guidance notes","Download the application form"]}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Vehicle registration document (V5c)","Vehicle insurance documents (insurance certificate and insurance premiums)","MOT certificate","A completed and signed scrappage scheme application form","Evidence that you are a sole trader (if applicable)"]}
You will need to upload these documents with your application form.

{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Start your application"}
Each organisation can only make one application to scrap up to three vehicles. You can't add or remove vehicles to your application once you've submitted it.
To start your application you'll need to sign in to or create a London Road User Charging (LRUC) account. On your account landing page look for the 'Scrappage scheme' link.

{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Organisations supporting ULEZ scrappage schemes"}
If you're scrapping your vehicle(s), consider replacing with a cargobike or vehicle sharing service. Find offers available to you through third party organisations .
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Eligiblity for heavy vehicles"}
The Mayor has announced that later in the year the existing van scrappage scheme will be broadened to include heavy vehicles , including lorries, coaches and buses.

If you're a small business or charity with 50 or fewer employees and you are interested in scrapping a heavy vehicle you can pre-register at info@locity.org.uk . In your email tell us what type of vehicles you operate. This will help us understand how many applicants we can expect for each type of vehicle. This facility is for registration of interest only. Enquiries about eligibility for the heavy vehicle element of the scheme will open when the scheme goes live later this year. If you want to make an enquiry about the current vans and minibuses scrappage scheme please contact ULEZ .
